description: People in southern Europe are advised to stay indoors or head for the mountains amid poor air quality.
title: Smog in southern Europe sparks car bans and street protests
title_page: Smog in southern Europe sparks car bans and street protests - BBC News
maintext: Italy's permitted limit for PM10 particles is 50 micrograms per cubic metre, but in recent days that limit has been exceeded - especially in the north, where monitoring stations near Bologna show levels as high as 125 micrograms per cubic metre.
